intro: Ruellia forsskaolii, commonly known as the African bellflower, is a flowering plant native to regions of Africa and the Arabian Peninsula. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters. The plant features opposite, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of tubular, bell-shaped flowers in shades of blue or violet. Ruellia forsskaolii thrives in well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardens. Its adaptability and attractive blooms contribute to its use in both horticultural and ecological settings.
